content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

To trigger a custom event from an action on a FlexCard, follow these steps:

1. Drag an Action element into a state in the FlexCard Designer.
2. Select Event from the Action Type dropdown.
3. Select Custom from the Event Type dropdown.
4. In Event Name, enter the name of the event.

Important: Do not use reserved names such as reload, updatedatasource, and remove.

Beginning Spring '22, you can register dynamic events based on a parent attribute or session variable by using context variables like {Parent.attr}, {recordId}, and {Session.var} in the Event Name field.

Optional steps:

* To enable the event to bubble up through the DOM, select Bubbles.
* To enable the event to pass through the shadow DOM boundary, select Compose.
* To pass contextual data as a key/value pair, click + Add New next to Input Parameters and enter a variable name in the Key field and value in the Value field.

To configure other options common among all action properties, see FlexCards Action Properties.

Configure the event listener that performs an action when the event is fired by adding an Event Listener to a FlexCard.
title: Triggering Custom Events in FlexCards
